replies.msg:
Milan swap Conti for Samp's Sala?

Milan are reportedly considering letting Andrea Conti join Sampdoria on loan and replacing him with Jacopo Sala.

According to Gazzetta dello Sport, Milan want to loan out Conti so he gets regular game time after two injury-plagued seasons.

With that in mind, the former Atalanta right-back could spend the forthcoming campaign at Samp.

In turn, the newspaper claims the Rossoneri will ask for Sala on the same basis, possibly with an option to buy.

The 27-year-old is a former Italy youth international, who spent his early career in England and Germany with Chelsea and Hamburg respectively.

He worked under new Diavolo boss Marco Giampaolo in each of the last three seasons and is understood to be willing to play second fiddle to Davide Calabria.
